intro: Galeopsis carpetana, commonly known as lesser hedge-nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and basil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It often grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and woodland edges. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
